result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen H. Foster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of $443 + $137.58 Officer OT costs = $580.58; due in $75 incriments per month, beginning 2/29/16 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 10 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
Submit a DNA Sample upon demand

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen H. Foster

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Jefferson Co. Sheriff Dept. - Reimb. of officer fees per court order. 16C 010579
Duplicate Original Warrant received from JCSD - with attached receipt showing payment of bond
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Case called at 1:33 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Stephen H. Foster in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS charge to reflect a violation of 450.11(7)(h) of the Wisconsin statutes, an unclassified misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of $443 + $137.58 Officer OT costs = $580.58; due in $75 incriments per month, beginning 2/29/16 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 10 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
Submit a DNA Sample upon demand
Recess: 1:47 pm

Case called at 3:15pm [mo]
Defendant Stephen H. Foster in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr.Foster   waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
recess: 3:17pm

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on  1/20/16 at 2:40pm  (2) Status Conference on 2/8/16 at 1:15pm
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Defendant appeared in-custody // Duplicate Original Warrant Returned from JCSD

Case called at 1:37 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Stephen H. Foster appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Whitney Hageman. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Hagemann presents basis for Mr. Foster's non-appearance, including some confusion
Bond arguments by Atty Flint

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.

Court requires a $100 CASH bond, with non-monetary conditions to remain the same:
-No contact with Cassandra Laycock
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-Booking
Recess: 1:40 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 12/22/15 at 3:00 pm - Send notices

Case called at 9:18am [mo]
[Scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today]
Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Stephen H. Foster not in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the Court Record, including letter from SPD office indicating that Mr. Foster is eligible for PD representation but an attorney was not available to appear at a hearing today.
The Court holds this case in abeyance until end of morning calendar. 
recess: 9:20am--reconvene:2:24pm

Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV
Defendant, Stephen Foster does NOT appear in court. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin
[Michelle Yaklovich is now the Court Reporter]

The Court reviews the Court Record.
On Motion of the State, the Court issues a bench warrant
The Court finds bond to be in default.
recess: 2:25pm
Letter from SPD advising the defendant does qualify for their representation however, there is no one available in their office for the 12-11-2015 hearing

Case called at 9:14am [mo]
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Stephen H. Foster in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber gives case synopsis; requests that case be scheduled for Preliminary Hearing. 
The Court inquires of Mr. Foster his intentions of obtaining counsel; Mr. Foster indicates that he is attempting to obtain private counsel, having difficulty obtaining retainer fee. 

The Court gives Mr. Foster his rights to counsel; further indicates that the Court will not further adjourn case proceedings to allow retention of counsel.
The Court instructs Mr. Foster that he and his counsel will need to be present at the next hearing.
recess: 9:18am

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 12/11/15 at 8:30am

Case called at 10:30am [mo]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Stephen H. Foster in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr. Foster indicates that he wishes to have counsel; needs additional time to obtain funds to retain an attorney.
The Court directs Mr. Foster to file a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel if he is unable to retain own counsel. 
recess: 10:32am

NEXT: Status Conference on 11/13/15 at 9:00am
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 11:10 am 
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Stephen H. Foster in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Mr. Foster informs the Court that he would like time to speak to counsel
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Cassandra Laycock
-Booking at JCSD 
Recess: 11:13 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 10/30/15 at 10:30 am - Send notices
